p: Additionally, the recorded plant reports were qualitatively compared with the most comprehensive worldwide wild food plant compendia [ 58, 59], the Italian medical ethnobotanical database [ 60], an ethnobotanical survey carried out in a nearby valley one decade ago [ 61], and a few recent, sporadic ethnobotanical studies conducted on the Italian side of the Alps [ 62â€“ 65], in order to point out possible novel reports (i.e. reports not previously recorded in the Italian ethnobotanical literature).
